intro: Licania parviflora var. pallida, commonly known as the pale-flowered licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Licania parviflora var. pallida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests.
